page.title: 08Castle-Douglas High School 1
page.content: Castle-Douglas H.S moved to its present site on Dunmuir Rd in 1956. It is a secondary school catering for 11-17 year old boys and girls. The Headmaster is Mr Campbell. The school has a roll of 460 pupils and 43 teachers. The roll of the school will decline over the next few years because of the declining birth rate. The school was upgraded to a five year school in 1979. There are 3 buildings: the main building, an extension which includes the library, and a games hall.The main subjects taught in the school are Maths, English, Modern Languages and Social Subjects. Senior pupils sit examinations for the Scottish Certificate of Education with a large measure of success.
